title: Comparing Standard Deviations of Data Sets
question_text:
Which set of data has the smallest standard deviation?
$A=\{1, 2, 3, 4, 5\}$
$B=\{10, 11, 12, 13, 14\}$
$C=\{0, 0, 10, 10\}$
$D=\{-5, -5, 0, 5, 5\}$
solution:
Data sets $A$ and $B$ have the same standard deviation.

The standard deviation can be thought of as the average or typical distance from the mean. Below are the steps on how to find the exact standard deviation for data set $A$.

Not that distance must be positive. This is why the values are squared.
